options.checkAccidentalRallyStartInfo: Chiedi conferma se "Inizia scambio" e premuto entro {{duration}}s dall'assegnazione di un punto

options.limitedBrowserSupportDesc: Il tuo browser non supporta il backup automatico. Per una migliore esperienza, usa Chrome o Edge.
options.eventBasedNote: Nota: Ogni download crea un nuovo file nella cartella Download
options.couldNotCheckUpdates: Impossibile verificare la presenza di aggiornamenti. Riprovare.
options.clearApplicationCacheInfo: Cancella le cache dei service worker e, facoltativamente, localStorage. Da usare se l'applicazione si comporta in modo inaspettato.
options.clearAllWarning: In questo modo si cancellano tutti i dati memorizzati nella cache e le impostazioni. La pagina verrà ricaricata dopo la cancellazione.
options.clearCacheWarning: In questo modo si cancellano i file memorizzati nella cache. Le impostazioni saranno conservate. La pagina verrà ricaricata dopo la cancellazione.
options.resetPreferencesWarning: Attenzione: Questa operazione ripristina tutte le preferenze predefinite.
options.startServerToConnect: Start the live server to allow referee and livescore apps to connect.
options.showNamesOnCourtInfo: Visualizzare i cognomi dei giocatori sotto i cerchi di posizione del campo
options.autoDownloadAtSetEnd: Download automatico dei dati alla fine del set
options.autoDownloadAtSetEndInfo: Scarica automaticamente i dati di gioco al termine di un set per il backup. In caso di emergenza, i dati locali possono essere utilizzati per ripristinare il gioco.
options.alwaysDownloadAtSetEnd: Scarica anche se la sync è riuscita
options.alwaysDownloadAtSetEndInfo: Scarica sempre il file di backup, anche quando la sincronizzazione cloud è riuscita. Per impostazione predefinita, il backup viene scaricato solo quando la sync fallisce o sei offline.
options.restoreFromCloudInfo: Sfogliare e ripristinare da backup automatici su cloud salvati durante la partita

demos.clickToScore: Click the buttons to see the score update!

quickstart.intro: Welcome to openBeach eScoresheet! This guide will help you understand how to use the app to score volleyball matches professionally.
quickstart.tip: For test/practice purposes, create a "Test Match" which has simpler requirements. For official matches, use "Official Match" which requires complete data entry.

home.intro: The Home Page is where you start and manage matches.
home.newMatchDesc: Click "New Match" to start recording a volleyball match. You have two options:
home.continueDesc: Resume a paused or in-progress match
home.deleteDesc: Remove the current match (requires PIN for official matches)
home.restoreDesc: Recover a match from a backup (local or cloud)

setup.intro: Configure all match details before starting to score.
setup.matchInfoDesc: Fill in the basic match details:
setup.teamStep2: Click the color swatch to choose team colors
setup.teamStep3: Optionally set short names for display
setup.playerStep2: Enter player's last and first name
setup.pdfTip: You can import rosters from PDF files using the "Import PDF" button. This automatically parses player data from official roster sheets.
setup.minPlayers: Each team must have exactly 2 players to proceed.
setup.signaturesDesc: For official matches, collect signatures from:
setup.sigNote: Tap the signature field to open the signing pad. Draw the signature and tap Save.

cointoss.intro: The coin toss determines which team serves first and which side each team starts on.
cointoss.howTo: How to Record the Coin Toss
cointoss.step1: Conduct the physical coin toss with team captains
cointoss.step2: Select which team won the toss (Team A or Team B)
cointoss.step3: Select which team will serve first
cointoss.step4: Select which team starts on the left side
cointoss.step6: Click "Start Match" to proceed to scoring
cointoss.set3Tip: In Set 3 (deciding set), there will be another coin toss at 8 points to determine sides and serve.

scoreboard.intro: The Scoreboard is the main interface for recording match events during play.
scoreboard.courtDesc: The court shows 6 positions numbered I through VI. Players rotate clockwise after winning a rally when receiving.
scoreboard.pointsDesc: Award points by clicking the team's point button after each rally:
scoreboard.pointsTip: When the receiving team scores, their players will automatically rotate clockwise.
scoreboard.ralliesDesc: Before recording points, you must start the rally:
scoreboard.startSetDesc: Use at the beginning of each set
scoreboard.lineupWarning: Both teams must set their initial lineup before the first rally can start.
scoreboard.timeoutsDesc: Each team can call 1 timeout per set, lasting 30 seconds.
scoreboard.toStep1: Click "TO Left" or "TO Right" button for the requesting team
scoreboard.toStep3: Click "Stop Timeout" when ready to resume play
scoreboard.toTip: The timeout counter (TO: 0/2) shows how many timeouts each team has used.
scoreboard.subsDesc: Each team can make up to 6 substitutions per set.
scoreboard.subClickDesc: Click on a court player, then select "Substitute" and choose another player
scoreboard.subDragDesc: Drag a court player to another player (or vice versa)
scoreboard.subLongPressDesc: Long press on a player to initiate drag mode
scoreboard.sanctionsDesc: Record disciplinary actions against players or teams:
scoreboard.expulsionDesc: Player leaves court for rest of set
scoreboard.undoDesc: Made a mistake? Use the Undo button to reverse the last action.
scoreboard.undoTip: You can undo multiple times to reverse several actions. The undo history is preserved until you start a new set.
scoreboard.rotationDesc: Watch how players rotate clockwise when the receiving team scores:
scoreboard.set3Desc: The deciding set has special rules:
scoreboard.set3Rule3: New coin toss determines serve and side

matchend.intro: When a team wins 3 sets, the match ends and you'll see the Match End screen.
matchend.reopenDesc: Need to make corrections? You can reopen the last set:
matchend.reopenWarning: Reopening a set will clear all collected signatures. You'll need to collect them again after making corrections.

shortcuts.intro: Speed up your scoring with keyboard shortcuts. Enable them in Settings.
shortcuts.customizeTip: You can customize these shortcuts in Settings → Keyboard Shortcuts → Configure Keys.

settings.accidentalRallyDesc: Confirm if "Start Rally" is pressed too quickly after awarding a point
settings.accidentalPointDesc: Confirm if a point is awarded too quickly after starting the rally
settings.backupDesc: Configure automatic backups to protect your match data:
settings.autoBackupDesc: Saves to selected folder on every change
settings.eventBackupDesc: Downloads at set start, set end, match end, timeouts

troubleshooting.intro: Having issues? Find answers to common problems below.
troubleshooting.q1: I accidentally awarded a point to the wrong team
troubleshooting.a1: Use the Undo button (or press Z) to reverse the last action. You can undo multiple times if needed. Then award the point to the correct team.
troubleshooting.q2: The score is wrong - how do I fix it?
troubleshooting.a2: Go to Menu → Manual Changes → Edit Current Set Score. You can manually adjust both team scores. For historical sets, use Edit All Sets.
troubleshooting.q3: I need to undo multiple actions
troubleshooting.a3: Click the Undo button repeatedly. Each click reverses one action. The undo history is preserved until the set ends.
troubleshooting.q4: Match ended but I made a mistake
troubleshooting.a4: On the Match End screen, click "Reopen Last Set" to go back to scoring mode. Note: this will clear all collected signatures.
troubleshooting.q5: App shows "Offline" - what do I do?
troubleshooting.a5: Don't worry! The app works offline. All data is saved locally and will sync when you're back online. Continue scoring normally.
troubleshooting.q6: Changes aren't syncing to the cloud
troubleshooting.a6: Check the connection status indicator. If offline, data will sync when reconnected. You can also go to Menu → Options → manually trigger sync from the Cloud Backup section.
troubleshooting.a7: Ensure: (1) Both devices are on the same WiFi network, (2) The dashboard server is running (check Options), (3) The correct PIN is entered, (4) Firewall isn't blocking the connection.
troubleshooting.q8: App crashed - how do I recover the match?
troubleshooting.a8: On the Home screen, click "Continue Match" if the match is still in progress. If that doesn't work, use "Restore Match" to recover from the latest backup.
troubleshooting.q9: How do I restore from a backup?
troubleshooting.a9: Go to Home → Restore Match. Choose either Cloud Backup (enter Game # and PIN) or Local Backup (select a .json backup file from your device).
troubleshooting.a10: For official matches, use "Restore Match" with the Game PIN. For test matches, you'll need a local backup file if available. Enable auto-backup to prevent future data loss.

dashboards.intro: Connect additional devices to display live match information to referees and teams.
dashboards.refereeDesc: Displays live score, timeouts, and last action for the referee.
dashboards.refStep2: Note the Referee PIN and URL
dashboards.refStep3: On the referee's device, open the Referee Dashboard page
dashboards.refTip: Scan the QR code shown in Options for quick access on mobile devices.
dashboards.startFirst: Start a rally first before awarding points.

timeoutDemo.title: Timeout Rules
timeoutDemo.instruction: See when timeouts can/cannot be called.
timeoutDemo.notDuringRally: Cannot call timeout during a rally!
timeoutDemo.alreadyActive: A timeout is already in progress!

subDemo.title: Substitution Rules
subDemo.instruction: Select a court player, then select another player to substitute.

mockups.screenStatesDesc: The scoreboard appears differently depending on what's happening in the match. Here are all the possible states:

startupConnectivity.serverUnavailable: Scoring works fully offline. Referee and livescore sync via Supabase — server is only needed as fallback.
startupConnectivity.backgroundRetry: La connessione verrà ritentata in background.
